flights.Key_Evidence: • Marks the moment immediately after landing; taxi-in clock starts here at 07:52, 48 min before its scheduled arrival time of 08:40. | • Previous flight at gate E12 (UAL1849) calls for push-back only at 08:22 – confirming the gate was still occupied for the first 30 min of SKW5617’s taxi because it landed far ahead of schedule. | • Shows UAL1849 taxiing out after push-back; with the gate now free, SKW5617 could proceed. No indication of any mechanical or staffing issue—blocking was purely timeline related. | • Controller references SKW5617’s gate (E12) becoming available, matching the sequence once the scheduled-turn aircraft departed.

Evidence_Details.message: United 1849, runway 19R, taxi via Alpha, Alpha ...
Evidence_Details.relevance: Shows UAL1849 taxiing out after push-back; with the gate now free, SKW5617 could proceed. No indication of any mechanical or staffing issue—blocking was purely timeline related.

Evidence_Details.message: …stand by, gate Echo 12, control by you, have a good day, thank you, Skywest 5617.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Controller references SKW5617’s gate (E12) becoming available, matching the sequence once the scheduled-turn aircraft departed.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Confirms the flight arrived far ahead of schedule, satisfying pure Early Arrival criteria. | • Ramp controller tells SKW4683 gate E6 won’t be free until ~08:25, showing the aircraft arrived before the gate could be vacated. | • Previous aircraft departed on-time/early, so the gate was legitimately occupied; delay stems from SKW4683’s early arrival, not a late departure. | • Shows multiple Skywest arrivals being told their gates are still occupied, consistent with early-arriving aircraft waiting for on-time departures to clear.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Controller immediately advises arriving aircraft that its assigned gate is still occupied, indicating the aircraft reached the ramp before the gate was free. | • Confirms the blocking aircraft was NOT late; therefore the gate would have been available at its scheduled time. The only reason it was still there when SKW5464 landed is because SKW5464 arrived 20 minutes early. | • Meets ≥15-minute early-arrival threshold, satisfying pure schedule-variance classification per rules.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Meets pure-schedule threshold for Early Arrival; this classification applies unless a higher-priority operational cause is proven. | • Rules out Late Departure / Late Tow-Off as root cause; supports that delay is not related to previous flight. | • Shows ramp immediately directing aircraft toward gate with no mention of mechanical, tow, or FAA hold; subsequent 47-min taxi therefore attributable to arriving well ahead of normal gate sequencing rather than a specific operational failure. | • System scan found no tow activity linked to F6, further eliminating Late Tow-Off as a higher-priority cause.

Evidence_Details.message: Landing Time 14:42 vs. Scheduled 15:06 → Schedule Variance ‑23.9 min (≥15 min early)
Evidence_Details.relevance: Meets pure-schedule threshold for Early Arrival; this classification applies unless a higher-priority operational cause is proven.

Evidence_Details.message: Previous flight at F6 (SKW5901) pushed 13:21, nine minutes BEFORE its 13:30 schedule ⇒ no late departure, gate vacant for >80 min before SKW5217 landed.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Rules out Late Departure / Late Tow-Off as root cause; supports that delay is not related to previous flight.

Evidence_Details.message: Skyway 5217 … ramp taxi west line to the gate.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Shows ramp immediately directing aircraft toward gate with no mention of mechanical, tow, or FAA hold; subsequent 47-min taxi therefore attributable to arriving well ahead of normal gate sequencing rather than a specific operational failure.

Evidence_Details.message: SuperTug/Undertow Detected: NO – Tow operations not observed; Gate Occupancy Evidence: NO
Evidence_Details.relevance: System scan found no tow activity linked to F6, further eliminating Late Tow-Off as a higher-priority cause.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Meets schedule-variance threshold for Early Arrival classification. | • Previous flight still occupying gate E4 after UAL2038 landed, confirming gate not yet available because current flight arrived well before the scheduled departure of UAL233. | • UAL2038 still taxiing more than 30 minutes after landing, indicating it had to hold/wait en-route to the gate. | • Shows aircraft requesting final clearance into ramp area, corroborating extended taxi-in while waiting for gate availability. | • Previous flight was not late enough (≥15 min) to invoke Late Departure; gate conflict arose primarily because UAL2038 arrived 26 min early.
